title: geth 1.7.2 crashes on mainnet , only starts after removedb , the same incident occured on 2 of my geth servers
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.7.2`
OS & Version: Linux

#### Backtrace

````

	/home/ubuntu/go-ethereum/build/_workspace/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/cmd/geth/main.go:198 +0x55
````
Geth was unable to restart until i used removedb , with geth version updated to 1.8.11 and go version 1.9.7 from 1.8.3

The older geth executable were working fine for almost 6 months , until the above issue , which occured on the instances in span of two days. After which both of them went down.

Also with geth updated , it has pulled almost 150000000 states and is still not in sync , i have taken the keystore backup , what is the issue here ?
We already had a fix for this problem. Here is the link https://github.com/syndtr/goleveldb/pull/214

Hi is this issue only specific to geth version 1.7.2 or every geth instance where the chaindata has reached above 1Tb storage ?

Before you answered , i switched the geth version to 1.8.11 and go version to 1.9 , what other thing do i need to update ?

> Hi is this issue only specific to geth version 1.7.2 or every geth instance where the chaindata has reached above 1Tb storage ?

Before the fix, all geth version will have this problem.

> Before you answered , i switched the geth version to 1.8.11 and go version to 1.9 , what other thing do i need to update ?

You mean the chain data is not between v1.7.2 and v1.8.11? Is there a problem with direct startup?
The latest version includes this fix, you can upgrade to latest or a stable version if you want.
